name: InputMasked
description: The InputMasked component uses the basic input component, but with some additional masking functionality.

props.name: prefix
props.doc: What to display before the amount. Defaults to an empty string.

props.name: suffix
props.doc: Text describing the content of the input more than the label. you can also send in a React component, so it gets wrapped inside the Input component.

props.name: includeThousandsSeparator
props.doc: Whether or not to separate thousands. Defaults to `true`.

props.name: thousandsSeparatorSymbol
props.doc: Character with which to separate thousands. Defaults to `' '`.

props.name: allowDecimal
props.doc: Whether or not to allow the user to enter a fraction with the amount. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: decimalSymbol
props.doc: Character that will act as a decimal point. Defaults to `','`.

props.name: decimalLimit
props.doc: How many digits to allow after the decimal. Defaults to `2`.

props.name: integerLimit
props.doc: Limit the length of the integer number. Defaults to `null` for unlimited.

props.name: requireDecimal
props.doc: Whether or not to always include a decimal point and placeholder for decimal digits after the integer. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: allowNegative
props.doc: Whether or not to allow negative numbers. Defaults to `true`.

props.name: disallowLeadingZeroes
props.doc: Whether or not to allow leading zeroes during typing. *A leading zero is any 0 digit that comes before the first nonzero digit in a number string in positional notation* - [wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leading_zero). Defaults to `false`.

props.name: as_number
props.doc: Set to `true` to automatically set a number mask based on the given or inherited locale.

props.name: as_percent
props.doc: Set to `true` to automatically set a number mask with a percentage sign based on the given or inherited locale.

props.name: as_currency
props.doc: Set to `true` to use `NOK` or give it a currency code e.g. `USD` to automatically set a currency mask based on the given or inherited locale.

props.name: mask_options
props.doc: Use it to manipulate internal masks. You can use it instead of e.g. `number_mask` or `currency_mask`. All options are listed below.

props.name: number_mask
props.doc: Set to `true` to enable the default numbers formatting – or give an `object` containing the number mask properties. More details below. Can be a JSON string as well, containing the number mask properties. Is disabled by default.

props.name: currency_mask
props.doc: Set to `true` or set the _valuta_ (currency_mask="kr") to enable a custom currency mask – or give an `object` containing the number mask properties. More details below. Can be a JSON string as well, containing the number mask properties. Is disabled by default. Defaults to `kr`.

props.name: number_format
props.doc: Use an object with [NumberFormat](/uilib/components/number-format/properties).

props.name: locale
props.doc: Define the locale to be used in the `as_number` or `as_currency` masked. It will be inherited from the [Eufemia Provider](/uilib/usage/customisation/provider) if not given. Defaults to `nb-NO`.

props.name: mask
props.doc: Each RegExp item in the array defines what the mask should be for each subsequent character in the input. The array length sets the inputs size/character limit.

props.name: show_mask
props.doc: Show mask when input is empty and has no focus. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: show_guide
props.doc: When `false` is given, it doesn't print out placeholder characters and only adds mask characters when the user reaches them as they're typing. Defaults to `true`.

props.name: placeholder_char
props.doc: The placeholder character represents the fillable spot in the mask (e.g. `_`). Defaults to invisible space.

props.name: keep_char_positions
props.doc: When `true`, adding or deleting characters will not affect the positions of existing characters. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: id
props.doc: (string) Defines input id. This id is also used to map the input value to the correct property on the objects used for `values` and `onChange` parameters.

props.name: label
props.doc: `legend` element describing the group of inputs inside the components.

props.name: placeholderCharacter
props.doc: Sets the placeholder character used for the input.

props.name: labelDirection
props.doc: Use to change the label layout direction. Defaults to `horizontal`.

props.name: inputs
props.doc: Array of [MultiInputMaskInput](/uilib/components/input-masked/properties/#multiinputmask-inputs-properties) that defines the inputs in the component. The id's defined here is used to map input value to correct property in `values` parameters used in `onChange`.

props.name: values
props.doc: Values used for the inputs in the component. Expects an object with keys matching the id's defined in `inputs`.

props.name: delimiter
props.doc: Character that separates the input inputs.

props.name: stretch
props.doc: Use `true` in order to stretch the input to the available space. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: status
props.doc: Text with a status message. The style defaults to an error message. You can use `true` to only get the status color, without a message.

props.name: statusState
props.doc: Defines the state of the status. It's two statuses [error, info]. Defaults to error.

events.name: on_change
events.doc: Will be called on value changes made by the user. Returns an object with the value as a string and the native event: `{ value, numberValue, cleanedValue, event }`.

events.name: onChange
events.doc: Runs when an input value changes. Has an object parameter with keys matching the id's defined in `inputs`, and values of string. E.g: `{month: string, year: string}`.

events.name: onFocus
events.doc: Runs when an input gains focus. Has an object parameter with keys matching the id's defined in `inputs`, and values of string. E.g: `{month: string, year: string}`.

events.name: onBlur
events.doc: Runs when an input lose focus. Has an object parameter with keys matching the id's defined in `inputs`, and values of string. E.g: `{month: string, year: string}`.
